name: Programmer CV
body:
### Gary Hess
github: @garbo999  
linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/gary-hess/5/6b3/a88  
mobile: +49 0174 3447047  
location: freiburg, germany
email: garyhess999@gmail.com

### TECHNICAL SKILLS
Ruby on Rails, Linux, Javascript, HTML5

### PROJECTS

- [TabCode][Link 1] -- I was given a package of Javascript code without a clear API. I studied the code and repackaged  it with examples. The goal was to make it possible for inexperienced users to display lute tablature on the web.

- [LaClaveciniste.Com][Link 3] -- I was given the design for a small site and rebuilt it using Rails and Bootstrap. The main task here was to take a design created on a Macbook and rebuild the HTML in a sensible way with Bootstrap. In terms of Rails, the highlight is the internationalization (I18n) with support for two languages (Estonian and English).

- Radiogetaway.Com -- I created the design and built this site using Rails and Bootstrap. The site uses the Devise and Omniauth gems and it is deployed on Heroku.

- Estonian Spidering Project (https://ancient-hollows-2475.herokuapp.com/nounparents) -- The goal of this work in progress was to develop a Ruby class that would spider the website http://www.filosoft.ee/gene_et/ and save the data on the local server. I am learning to use the MECHANIZE and PG_SEACH gems.

- [Garage48 project][Link 2]: 

- TRB4 -- I partnered with a friend in a startup in the translation industry in San Francisco. We initially paid an external company to code our webservice (a search engine for existing translations), then I took over the programming duties and rebuilt and finished the site (now defunct) using PHP and Oracle.

### EDUCATION

- BS Electrical Engineering from North Carolina State University: My degree included several programming courses including data structures. I also taught labs for several semesters in which the students were required to write and debug programs to interface microcontrollers with various types of hardware. 
- "Algorithms: Design and Analysis, Parts 1 and 2" from Coursera (Stanford University)
- "Software as a Service, Parts 1 and 2" from edX (University of California at Berkeley)
- "Learn HTML5 from W3C" from edX (W3C)

[Link 1]: https://github.com/garbo999/TabCode
[Link 2]: http://garage48.org/blog/othe-winner-of-garage48-tip-will-disrupt-traffickers-by-scanning-online-ads
[Link 3]: LaClaveciniste.Com
